importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the death of Doug Martin was reported by police and public officials, marking the official announcement of the incident.
The date of Doug Martin's selection as the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft, a key milestone in his career that established his prominence in professional football.
The date when Martin achieved first-team All-Pro status and Pro Bowl selection after a strong season with 1,402 rushing yards and six touchdowns.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin rose to prominence in the NFL, establishing himself as a key running back with standout performances that defined his career.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back and All-Pro, died after a brief struggle with police during a home break-in investigation in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of death and had a notable career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being selected as a Pro Bowl and All-Pro player.
He was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State and finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during detainment; no further details were released.
Martin's family requested privacy, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers expressed condolences.
An autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of death, which has not been released.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history, underscoring his lasting legacy.

namedEntities.name: Doug Martin
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former professional NFL running back and former All-Pro player
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure in the article, as the individual who died during a police encounter, prompting public and institutional responses.

namedEntities.name: Tampa Bay Buccaneers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The team that Doug Martin played for the majority of his career and acknowledged his legacy by honoring him as one of their top 50 players.

namedEntities.name: Oakland Police Department
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Local law enforcement agency in Oakland, California
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The department was responsible for detaining Doug Martin and is directly linked to the incident that led to his death.

namedEntities.name: Barbara Lee
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She publicly expressed condolences and acknowledged Martin as an Oaklander, linking the incident to local community concerns about police conduct and safety.

namedEntities.name: Boise State
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: University where Doug Martin played college football
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Martin's college career at Boise State is referenced as the foundation of his professional draft selection and early success.

namedEntities.name: Alameda County Coroner's Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Public health and legal authority responsible for autopsies
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The office conducted the autopsy to determine the cause of death, a key procedural step in the investigation and public transparency.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during a break-in investigation at a home in Oakland. At 36, Martin had a prolific career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning All-Pro and Pro Bowl honors. The incident sparked public concern over police interactions with former athletes, especially those from marginalized communities. The Oakland Police Department reported a brief struggle during detainment, but no further details were released. His family requested privacy, and officials including Mayor Barbara Lee and the Buccaneers expressed deep sorrow. An autopsy is underway to determine the cause of death, which has not been disclosed.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detainment During Break-In Investigation
